org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client

Class AsyncTableImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.AsyncTableImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncTable, AsyncTableBase

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
class AsyncTableImpl
extends Object
implements AsyncTable
    The implementation of AsyncTable. Based on RawAsyncTable.

      • setReadRpcTimeout

        public void setReadRpcTimeout(long timeout,
                              TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Set timeout of each rpc read request in operations of this Table instance, will override the value of hbase.rpc.read.timeout in configuration. If a rpc read request waiting too long, it will stop waiting and send a new request to retry until retries exhausted or operation timeout reached.
        Specified by:
        setReadRpcTimeout in interface AsyncTableBase

        Set timeout of each rpc write request in operations of this Table instance, will override the value of hbase.rpc.write.timeout in configuration. If a rpc write request waiting too long, it will stop waiting and send a new request to retry until retries exhausted or operation timeout reached.

      • setOperationTimeout

        public void setOperationTimeout(long timeout,
                                TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Set timeout of each operation in this Table instance, will override the value of hbase.client.operation.timeout in configuration.

        Operation timeout is a top-level restriction that makes sure an operation will not be blocked more than this. In each operation, if rpc request fails because of timeout or other reason, it will retry until success or throw a RetriesExhaustedException. But if the total time elapsed reach the operation timeout before retries exhausted, it will break early and throw SocketTimeoutException.

        Specified by:
        setOperationTimeout in interface AsyncTableBase

      • getOperationTimeout

        public long getOperationTimeout(TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Get timeout of each operation in Table instance.
        Specified by:
        getOperationTimeout in interface AsyncTableBase

      • setScanTimeout

        public void setScanTimeout(long timeout,
                           TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Set timeout of a single operation in a scan, such as openScanner and next. Will override the value hbase.client.scanner.timeout.period in configuration.

        Generally a scan will never timeout after we add heartbeat support unless the region is crashed. The scanTimeout works like the operationTimeout for each single operation in a scan.

        Specified by:
        setScanTimeout in interface AsyncTableBase

        Get the timeout of a single operation in a scan.

      • get

        public CompletableFuture<Result> get(Get get)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Extracts certain cells from a given row.
        Specified by:
        get in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        get - The object that specifies what data to fetch and from which row.
        Returns:
        The data coming from the specified row, if it exists. If the row specified doesn't exist, the Result instance returned won't contain any KeyValue, as indicated by Result.isEmpty(). The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • append

        public CompletableFuture<Result> append(Append append)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Appends values to one or more columns within a single row.

        This operation does not appear atomic to readers. Appends are done under a single row lock, so write operations to a row are synchronized, but readers do not take row locks so get and scan operations can see this operation partially completed.

        Specified by:
        append in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        append - object that specifies the columns and amounts to be used for the increment operations
        Returns:
        values of columns after the append operation (maybe null). The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • increment

        public CompletableFuture<Result> increment(Increment increment)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Increments one or more columns within a single row.

        This operation does not appear atomic to readers. Increments are done under a single row lock, so write operations to a row are synchronized, but readers do not take row locks so get and scan operations can see this operation partially completed.

        Specified by:
        increment in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        increment - object that specifies the columns and amounts to be used for the increment operations
        Returns:
        values of columns after the increment. The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • checkAndPut

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> checkAndPut(byte[] row,
                                              byte[] family,
                                              byte[] qualifier,
                                              CompareFilter.CompareOp compareOp,
                                              byte[] value,
                                              Put put)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Atomically checks if a row/family/qualifier value matches the expected value. If it does, it adds the put. If the passed value is null, the check is for the lack of column (ie: non-existence)
        Specified by:
        checkAndPut in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        row - to check
        family - column family to check
        qualifier - column qualifier to check
        compareOp - comparison operator to use
        value - the expected value
        put - data to put if check succeeds
        Returns:
        true if the new put was executed, false otherwise. The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • checkAndDelete

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> checkAndDelete(byte[] row,
                                                 byte[] family,
                                                 byte[] qualifier,
                                                 CompareFilter.CompareOp compareOp,
                                                 byte[] value,
                                                 Delete delete)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Atomically checks if a row/family/qualifier value matches the expected value. If it does, it adds the delete. If the passed value is null, the check is for the lack of column (ie: non-existence)
        Specified by:
        checkAndDelete in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        row - to check
        family - column family to check
        qualifier - column qualifier to check
        compareOp - comparison operator to use
        value - the expected value
        delete - data to delete if check succeeds
        Returns:
        true if the new delete was executed, false otherwise. The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • mutateRow

        public CompletableFuture<Void> mutateRow(RowMutations mutation)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Performs multiple mutations atomically on a single row. Currently Put and Delete are supported.
        Specified by:
        mutateRow in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        mutation - object that specifies the set of mutations to perform atomically
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that always returns null when complete normally.

      • checkAndMutate

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> checkAndMutate(byte[] row,
                                                 byte[] family,
                                                 byte[] qualifier,
                                                 CompareFilter.CompareOp compareOp,
                                                 byte[] value,
                                                 RowMutations mutation)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Atomically checks if a row/family/qualifier value matches the expected value. If it does, it performs the row mutations. If the passed value is null, the check is for the lack of column (ie: non-existence)
        Specified by:
        checkAndMutate in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        row - to check
        family - column family to check
        qualifier - column qualifier to check
        compareOp - the comparison operator
        value - the expected value
        mutation - mutations to perform if check succeeds
        Returns:
        true if the new put was executed, false otherwise. The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • smallScan

        public CompletableFuture<List<Result>> smallScan(Scan scan,
                                                 int limit)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTableBase
        Return all the results that match the given scan object. The number of the returned results will not be greater than limit.

        Notice that the scan must be small, and should not use batch or allowPartialResults. The caching property of the scan object is also ignored as we will use limit instead.

        Specified by:
        smallScan in interface AsyncTableBase
        Parameters:
        scan - A configured Scan object.
        limit - the limit of results count
        Returns:
        The results of this small scan operation. The return value will be wrapped by a CompletableFuture.

      • scan0

        private void scan0(Scan scan,
                   ScanResultConsumer consumer)

      • scan

        public void scan(Scan scan,
                 ScanResultConsumer consumer)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncTable
        The scan API uses the observer pattern. All results that match the given scan object will be passed to the given consumer by calling ScanResultConsumer.onNext(Result). ScanResultConsumer.onComplete() means the scan is finished, and ScanResultConsumer.onError(Throwable) means we hit an unrecoverable error and the scan is terminated.
        Specified by:
        scan in interface AsyncTable
        Parameters:
        scan - A configured Scan object.
        consumer - the consumer used to receive results.
